content.title: Strategic Property Advisor (5P0496)
content.description:
Homes England is the new national housing agency, recently launched to play a major role in fixing the housing market and enabling delivery of homes that our country needs.

The Strategic Growth Team is a new, small multi-disciplinary team within the Strategy, Performance and Delivery Unit at Homes England. Its remit is to lead on, and provide support to, large-scale, complex and innovative projects that require cross-boundary, cross-government and cross-discipline working, such as the Cambridge-Milton Keynes-Oxford Arc, Thames Estuary opportunities and rail related growth around Crossrail, HS1 and HS2.

To support the team, we are looking to recruit three talented professionals with strategic planning, infrastructure and property backgrounds and with a range of experience that spans delivery and cross-government working to help shape policy and influence key decisions.

This role can be based in any location, but frequent travel to other offices, including to London will be required.

Homes England is the new national housing agency, recently launched to play a major role in fixing the housing market and enabling delivery of homes that our country needs.
Homes England brings together land, money, expertise, and planning & compulsory purchase powers, with a clear remit to facilitate delivery of sufficient new homes, where they are most needed, to deliver a sustained improvement in affordability. We work locally in individual communities to help meet local priorities.
We invest mostly in building new homes, but also in creating employment floor space and other community facilities, in cities, towns and villages across the country. The homes we fund include affordable homes for rent and sale, and homes for rent or sale at market prices. Our investment helps build around half of all new homes built in England each year. It also helps increase local growth by creating jobs and supporting businesses.
We own public land, which we sell to house builders and others. This is one of the ways in which we overcome barriers to development and help increase the speed with which house builders can build new homes.
Homes England is an executive non-departmental public body, sponsored by the Ministry of Housing, Communities & Local Government.

Homes England was launched by the Secretary of State on 11 January 2018. Homes England is the trading name of Homes and Communities Agency. To find out more about what we do please visit: www.gov.uk/government/organisations/homes-england.
content.contactName:
For more information on the role, please see the attached document named ‘Strategic Property Advisor- Role Remit'

If you would like to apply for the role, please complete the document named 'Homes England Application Form' along with the ‘Diversity Form’ and return it to recruitment@homesengland.gov.uk before the deadline stated. Your email should include the job title and reference number of the post you are applying for.

Blind Shortlisting – We carry out blind short listing for all of our vacancies as part of our commitment to Diversity and ensuring a fair and consistent approach to recruitment. Candidates will be assigned a number and recruiting managers are sent only the application form to assess for shortlisting.

Application Form - Within the form you are required to provide all relevant details and a supporting statement with specific examples of where your skills, knowledge and experience relate to the main accountabilities in the job remit and to the Homes England competencies in the competency framework, attached for your information.

Diversity Form – Within the form you are required to provide all the relevant details to ensure that we can match your blind application form back to you as an individual.

Successful applicants will be advised of the outcome of their application and interviews held as soon as practical after the closing date. The application and selection process is competency-based, and you should familiarise yourself with the relevant competency framework before attending an interview.

Please note – we do not accept CVs as a form of application.

Due to the high volume of applications we receive we are regretfully unable to respond to every application individually. If you do not hear from us within four weeks of the adverts closing date we will not be progressing with your application. We would like to take this opportunity to thank you for your interest in this role.

If you need the application form, or any of the other materials, in a different format, please email recruitment@homesengland.gov.uk.

parent.name: Ministry of Housing, Communities & Local Government

Interview dates and locations are to be confirmed.

content.workingPatterns: Flexible working, Full-time
content.whatWeOffer:
Homes England is an executive non-departmental public body with its own terms and conditions, benefits and pension scheme. We are a government agency working in partnership with the private sector and want to employ and retain great people. In return we offer a range of excellent benefits.

Holiday - Homes England offers all staff 33 days annual leave per year in addition to 8 statutory bank holidays.

Working Flexibly - At Homes England we have a strong culture of flexible working and encourage all employees to have a healthy work/life balance. We offer a wide range of potential working patterns, including part time, job share and compressed hours.

These need to be balanced with business needs so they will vary from job to job. If you would like to know more please speak to the Recruiting Manager.

Health and Wellbeing - We offer health screening with Nuffield Proactive Health Clinics, a free Employee Assistance Programme which offers confidential support 24 hours a day, 7 days a week as well as access to Occupational Health.

Professional Development - At Homes England we are committed to your continued professional and personal development with learning as one of our core values. We pay for one job-related professional membership subscription per year for our employees.


We also offer an excellent range of family friendly benefits, for example, maternity, paternity, shared parental leave.

If anyone has any queries on any of these terms and conditions, please get in touch for further information.

content.title: 19223721-EXT - Screening and Immunisation Manager
content.description:
Clinical & Non-Clinical

“Please note that there are two potential sets of criteria in order to fulfil this role, which is outlined in the attached job descriptions. Should you be successful in applying for this post, you will be offered the terms and conditions that correspond to the person specification and criteria that you meet. Clinical roles are part of the PHE Clinical Ring Fence and as such are offered under analogous NHS Terms and Conditions. Non-clinical roles are offered under PHE Terms and Conditions.”

(Clinical) AFC Band 8a -salary £42,414 - £49,969 – JD under Job Description

(Non-Clinical) Civil Service Grade 7 – salary £48,852- £60,226– JD under Person Specification

Public Health England is looking for a new manager for its screening and immunisation services.

Screening and Immunisation teams are embedded within NHS England, and provide leadership and support to the commissioning function as well as working closely with service providers and local stakeholders to improve the quality and uptake of these life-saving interventions.

Priority consideration for this post will be given to applicants, in line with the National Policy on the Process for Filling of Posts and the PHE Recruitment Controls:

Eligibility Paragraph to be inserted by HR recruitment team depending on the stage of recruitment

Job Purpose / Summary

PHE has a vacancy for a manager within the Screening and Immunisation team embedded within NHS England South East, covering primarily Surrey and Sussex. This is an exciting opportunity to contribute to the development and implementation of high quality immunisation and screening services. You will be part of an established team and will have a valuable role in shaping the delivery of these services. The current commissioning arrangements offer great opportunities to improve the quality and success of these high profile and important preventative programmes.

The role of the Screening and Immunisation Manager is to support the commissioning of consistently resilient, high quality national screening and immunisation programmes within Surrey & Sussex, working within a wider collaborative framework, including Kent and Medway. . You will provide direct support to the Screening and Immunisation Lead across the full range of commissioning activities, as specified in the Section 7a agreement and which are required to ensure that screening and immunisation programmes meet national requirements, deliver in a safe and effective fashion, and help reduce inequalities.

The Immunisation and Screening Manager will line manage a small team of screening and immunisation coordinators/assistant coordinators who will implement strategies and plans to support continuous improvement of the commissioning and delivery of the national programmes.

Individuals in these roles may come from a number of backgrounds, including nursing as demonstrated for example by NMC or PH registration.

Applicants should have experience of managing multiple projects, leading service improvement and building effective working relationships. Ideally applicants should have a sound knowledge of screening and/or immunisation programmes: training will be provided for successful applicants who demonstrate transferrable skills.

If you are a clinician you will be recruited as a Screening and Immunisation Clinical Manager and this will be a clinical-ring fenced post with NHS Terms and Conditions. Otherwise, you will be recruited as a non-clinical Screening and Immunisation Manager under Civil Service Terms & Conditions.

Secondments/job share and part time applicants considered.

Applicants are strongly advised to use the criteria in the person specification (available online) as sub-headings in their application to make it clear how they meet each of the selection criteria.

Open to all external applicants (anyone) from outside the Civil Service (including by definition internal applicants).

Public Health England promotes diversity in the workplace and is an equal opportunities employer

For further details / informal visits contact:

Dr Max Kammerling, Screening and Immunisation lead 07894 340590, m.kammerling@nhs.net
content.contactName:
For further details / informal visits contact:

Dr Max Kammerling, Screening and Immunisation lead 07894 340590, m.kammerling@nhs.net

content.title: Band A - Senior Business Analyst (Ref: 2826)
content.description:
The Cabinet Office Digital & Technology team is looking for a Senior Business Analyst to help grow its digital capability.

You’ll work as part of a small cross-functional agile team, amongst digital and policy experts in the heart of the central government machine in Whitehall, delivering internal and public facing digital services that meet user needs and Cabinet Office policy objectives. Our team provides delivery, consultation and assurance services throughout the Cabinet Office, working with policy and operational units across the department to deliver broad digital transformation.

Our work covers a wide and interesting array of policy areas across the whole of the Cabinet Office’s varied functions including National Security & Civil Contingencies, Electoral Registration, Fraud, Error & Debt and Honours & Appointments. Alongside these core policy areas, you will support Civil Service functions such as HR, Finance & Commercial, as they grow their digital capability and iterate their services.
Job description

Main responsibilities

As a Senior Business Analyst, you will:

Work as part of cross-functional agile teams, delivering new digital services that meet user needs and Cabinet Office policy objectives

Understand, map and document complex business processes and services including performance/KPIs and volumetrics

Understand business and stakeholder requirements through common requirement elicitation techniques

Work closely with user researchers to understand user needs, write user stories and acceptance criteria documenting both user and business needs as well as enabling development teams to understand the context behind them

Liaise with technical architects to identify and select appropriate technical solutions based on a deep understanding of requirements

Support product managers to form and groom product backlogs, using evidence and data to drive prioritisation and scope

Liaise with service managers, product owners and delivery managers to support the necessary business change activities required

Ensure business requirements are fully understood by external suppliers and work with those suppliers to support delivery through planning, implementation and testing

Carry out functional testing of completed user stories, ensuring services meet requirements and other internal standards, documenting and managing defects as they arise

As appropriate, coach and mentor junior Business Analysts in the team and provide expertise to units around Cabinet Office

Skills and experience

It is essential that you have:

A deep understanding of agile, and have experience of working in a dynamic, fast paced environment, as well as working collaboratively and openly with others

Experience working with a broad range of stakeholders (including at senior/C suite/senior civil servant level) to elicit business requirements and model complex business processes

Experience of documenting user needs and requirements in the form of user stories but also have experience of more traditional requirements documentation

Strong communication, presentation and facilitation skills

Experience working with backlog and defect tracking tools such as JIRA

Passion for building digital services using user-centred approaches

It is desirable that you have:

Experience of common CRM and CMS solutions including for example Salesforce Classic and Lightning and WordPress

Experience in defining and interpreting web analytics

Experience of software testing including acceptance test automation, smoke tests and BDD

Familiarity with the Digital Service Standard and working with Government Digital Services (GDS)

Please note that this role requires SC clearance, which would normally require 5 years’ UK residency in the past 5 years. This is not an absolute requirement but supplementary checks may be required where individuals have not lived in the UK for the required period. This may mean that your security clearance (and therefore your appointment) will take longer or, in some cases, not be possible.
content.contactName: Please contact kate.owen@cabinetoffice.gov.uk for additional information or with any queries.

content.title: Digital Product Officer
content.description:
About the role

We're looking for an experienced product officer to help us transform our ýdigital services.

Working closely with our product managers and user researchers, the successful candidate will act as the performance analyst for our agile digital teams.

In your day-to-day work, you’ll get to:

Set up and monitor our analytics account to ensure we understand how we’re doing and how we can improve
Report on the performance of our services and champion the use of this information
Work as part of agile teams taking projects through Government Digital Service (GDS) approvals.
If you're an expert in Google Analytics and you have a passion for building services around the needs of the user, come and join our team. If you have experience of GDS assessments and approvals too, you’ll be a great fit for the role.

About you

Educated to degree level or equivalent, you're used to delivering projects for large organisations and managing a range of stakeholders.

You have experience of using advanced features of Google Analytics and using it to track and report on key performance indicators. You can draw out key conclusions from research and business objectives and produce evidence to support the design of services.

Most of all, you’re a team player with strong communication and presentation skills and a passion for delivering services that are simple to use and built around the needs of their users.

Closing date – Tuesday 21st August 2018 at 11.45pm

External Candidate Information

Please provide referee details for a full 3 year employment history on your application along with relevant information to support any gaps in employment, we will not approach your referees without your prior consent.
Please note that if you have not heard from us within 6 weeks of this vacancy closing, you can assume that you have been unsuccessful on this occasion.
Unfortunately, due to the high volume of applications being received across all of our vacancies, we are unable to provide individual feedback at application stage.
We must also inform you that, in line with the majority of government organisations, we do not pay travelling expenses for interviewees.
Tier 2

CQC are currently not able to accept applications from anyone requiring Tier 2 sponsorship because there are currently no Tier 2 vacancies.
